Schoenberg, Arnold.translation[0].defini: (1874–1951) an Austrian composer who went to the US in 1933. He invented the ‘twelve-tone system’ of writing modern music, in which music is written around a set of twelve notes of a Chromaticscale. His system has influenced many modern composers. His works include Transfigured Night,  Pierrot Lunaire, and an  opera  that he did not finish Moses and Aaron.
